mdRecord.dcterms:title: General Grant's boys: Air: "Old Virgina [sic] low lands, low." / Respectfully dedicated to the Army of the Potomac by James D. Gay, No. 300 North 20th Street Philadelphia, Pa. ; All of Gay's army songs sent by mail
Copperheads and traitors to you these lines we write
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Gay, James D.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chs. Magnus 12 Frankfort St. N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in four stanzas and chorus; without music; printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line: Ye Copperheads and traitors to you these lines we write.
"Entered according to Act of Congress in the year 1864, by James d. Gay, in the Clerks' Office of the Eastern District of Pennsylvania." -- 12 mm. below text.
Hand-colored headpiece, captioned "Richmond." Magnus 61. Cf. American song sheets, 724c.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Fourteenth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Songs and music--Texts
Richmond (Va.)--Pictorial works
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: New York (City), New York (State), United States
